DOC.brief_summary: This Internet-based survey transgender transsexual ( trans ) people age 18 year old living Australia . This population receive limited attention public health researcher , planner , practitioner . However , grow body evidence suggest trans people experience disparity several important area health compare population generally . In particular , trans people likely experience mental health problem ( notably depression anxiety disorder ) , use alcohol , tobacco , illicit drug , think attempt suicide . Additionally , trans people commonly report physical mental health need meet , underutilise preventive health care . Participants recruit use several non-probability sample technique , ( include purposive sample snowball sampling ) , random sample possible population . Medical , social , support , advocacy network use trans people use promote study . A mixed quantitative qualitative methodology use . Validated quantitative instrument use obtain measure health well-being , compare population norm . Qualitative item complement measure , provide rich experiential data . The investigator hypothesise : - prevalence depressive anxiety disorder high population generally , condition commonly undiagnosed untreated ; - depressive anxiety disorder associate risky behaviour , tobacco , alcohol , illicit drug use ; , - trans people report poor relationship medical practitioner . The investigator hypothesise poor mental health consequence several interrelated factor : body dysphoria ( consequence experience difficulty access medical treatment alter sexual characteristic ) ; societal discrimination stigma ( include harassment violence ) ; institutionalise discrimination ( include difficulty change identify document , exclusion surgical procedure related treatment public private health system ) ; social isolation ; belief hold many clinician transsexualism mental disorder ( may barrier trans people form trust relationship medical practitioner ) .
DOC.brief_title: First Australian National Trans Mental Health Study
